pr_title: Fix direct return of byte binary operation in a lambda

timeline.message: Use expected type of binary expr in byte convertion

timeline.bodyText:
With new lang tests we've tried writing the tests in Ballerina itself as much as possible.
For example https://github.com/ballerina-platform/ballerina-lang/blob/master/tests/jballerina-unit-test/src/test/resources/test-src/expressions/listconstructor/list_constructor_infer_type.bal#L55
We can rewrite these tests similarly right?
timeline.author: MaryamZi

replies.bodyText: looks like you have to repeat the assertEquality method for each new test bal file?
replies.author: Kishanthan

replies.bodyText: And yes, we can write that in the new style. The thing is all the other methods are written in the old way. May be we have to add a new bal test file with these new tests.
replies.author: Kishanthan

replies.bodyText: For the time-being yes, the assertEquality function has to be repeated in each test file. But once the compiler test suite is done we can directly switch to calling a similar (most-likely the same) function in that particular module.
replies.author: MaryamZi

replies.bodyText:
Yeah, there is some inconsistency when adding tests to an existing file. But even then, IMO it's kinda OK given that we usually add new tests at the end?
I'm OK with either approach.
replies.author: MaryamZi

timeline.message: Assert test results in Ballerina itself
